title: Particle motion with quadratic velocity function part - c

content.description: A particle moves on the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t)=12t2−36t+15 . At t =1 , the particle is at the origin.
content.question: Find the maximum velocity of the particle for 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.

frqParts.text: Find the maximum velocity of the particle for 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
